title: Track Awesome Libgdx Updates Weekly
_seo_title: Track Awesome Libgdx (rafaskb/awesome-libgdx) Updates Weekly - Track Awesome List
description: üéÆ üìù A curated list of libGDX resources to help developers make awesome games.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Dec 02 - Dec 08, 2024
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Dec 02 - Dec 08, 2024
items.content_text:
### Resources / Others

*   [libGDX Plugin (‚≠ê157)](https://github.com/BlueBoxWare/LibGDXPlugin) - A plugin for IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio that adds a number of libGDX features and tools, such as color previews and additional inspections for common mistakes.

### Tutorials / General Learning Material

*   [Book of Shaders (‚≠ê6.4k)](https://github.com/patriciogonzalezvivo/thebookofshaders) - Step-by-step guide through the abstract and complex universe of Fragment Shaders. GLSL.
*   [Game Programming Patterns](https://gameprogrammingpatterns.com/) - Architecture and design patterns for games.
items.content_html:
Resources / Others

  • libGDX Plugin (‚≠ê157) - A plugin for IntelliJ IDEA and Android Studio that adds a number of libGDX features and tools, such as color previews and additional inspections for common mistakes.

Tutorials / General Learning Material

  • Book of Shaders (‚≠ê6.4k) - Step-by-step guide through the abstract and complex universe of Fragment Shaders. GLSL.
  • Game Programming Patterns - Architecture and design patterns for games.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jul 10 - Jul 16, 2023
items.summary: 5 awesome projects updated on Jul 10 - Jul 16, 2023
items.content_text:
### Resources / Setup and Deployment

*   [gdx-liftoff (‚≠ê607)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/gdx-liftoff) - A modern setup tool for libGDX that supports more backends and allows adding libraries with one click.
*   [libgdx-library-template (‚≠ê16)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/libgdx-library-template) - A skeleton project for making new libraries, since they need different config.

### Resources / User Interface

*   [TextraTypist (‚≠ê116)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/textratypist) - Like TypingLabel (below), but also supports styles, emoji, multiple fonts, clickable links, etc.

### Resources / Visual Effects

*   [colorful-gdx (‚≠ê89)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/colorful-gdx) - Expands how tinting can affect colors; also has many pre-written shaders.

### Resources / Others

*   [anim8-gdx (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/anim8-gdx) - Allows saving (animated) GIFs and PNGs from sequences of Pixmaps, with configurable dithering if needed.
items.content_html:
Resources / Setup and Deployment

  • gdx-liftoff (‚≠ê607) - A modern setup tool for libGDX that supports more backends and allows adding libraries with one click.
  • libgdx-library-template (‚≠ê16) - A skeleton project for making new libraries, since they need different config.

Resources / User Interface

  • TextraTypist (‚≠ê116) - Like TypingLabel (below), but also supports styles, emoji, multiple fonts, clickable links, etc.

Resources / Visual Effects

  • colorful-gdx (‚≠ê89) - Expands how tinting can affect colors; also has many pre-written shaders.

Resources / Others

  • anim8-gdx (‚≠ê48) - Allows saving (animated) GIFs and PNGs from sequences of Pixmaps, with configurable dithering if needed.

*   [gdx-miniaudio (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/rednblackgames/gdx-miniaudio) - Advanced Cross Platform Audio Engine for libGDX based on MiniAudio.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Apr 25 - May 01, 2022
items.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Apr 25 - May 01, 2022
items.content_text:
### Tutorials / Getting Started

*   [Scene2D.UI From the Ground Up (‚≠ê465)](https://github.com/raeleus/skin-composer/wiki/From-the-Ground-Up:-Scene2D.UI-Tutorials) - Covers the basics of UI design in Scene2D, libGDX's premiere scene graph and layout toolkit.

### Tutorials / Advanced

*   [Introduction to 3D Series](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjUR2MkQ0cuHZ70Ps8F9WMyoyKHKAbYvQ) - A tutorial series on libGDX 3D using gdx-gltf.
items.content_html:
Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Scene2D.UI From the Ground Up (‚≠ê465) - Covers the basics of UI design in Scene2D, libGDX's premiere scene graph and layout toolkit.

Tutorials / Advanced

  • Introduction to 3D Series - A tutorial series on libGDX 3D using gdx-gltf.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jan 17 - Jan 23, 2022
items.summary: 5 awesome projects updated on Jan 17 - Jan 23, 2022
items.content_text:
### Resources / Physics

*   [Box2D](https://libgdx.com/wiki/extensions/physics/box2d) - One of the most popular physics libraries for 2D games.
*   [Bullet](https://libgdx.com/wiki/extensions/physics/bullet/bullet-physics) - 3D Collision Detection and Rigid Body Dynamics Library.

### Resources / User Interface

*   [Freetype](https://libgdx.com/wiki/extensions/gdx-freetype) - Generate BitmapFonts of your desired size on the fly from lightweight .ttf font files.

### Tutorials / Getting Started

*   [Official libGDX Wiki](https://libgdx.com/wiki/) - Official libGDX wiki that contains a huge amount of information.
*   [libGDX External Tutorials](https://libgdx.com/wiki/articles/external-tutorials) - Big list of official unofficial tutorials.
items.content_html:
Resources / Physics

  • Box2D - One of the most popular physics libraries for 2D games.
  • Bullet - 3D Collision Detection and Rigid Body Dynamics Library.

Resources / User Interface

  • Freetype - Generate BitmapFonts of your desired size on the fly from lightweight .ttf font files.

Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Official libGDX Wiki - Official libGDX wiki that contains a huge amount of information.
  • libGDX External Tutorials - Big list of official unofficial tutorials.

items.content_text:
### Resources / Editors

*   [HyperLap2D (‚≠ê403)](https://github.com/rednblackgames/HyperLap2D) - Visual editor for complex 2D worlds and scenes with a runtime for libGDX.
*   [Spine](http://esotericsoftware.com/) - Skeleton-based animation tool that focuses specifically on 2D animation for games.

### Tutorials / Getting Started

*   [Brandon Grasley's Space Shooter Game](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLfd-5Q3Fwq0WKrkEKw12nqpfER3MG5_Wi) - Video tutorial series on making a complete Android game from scratch.
items.content_html:

  • Spine - Skeleton-based animation tool that focuses specifically on 2D animation for games.

Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Brandon Grasley's Space Shooter Game - Video tutorial series on making a complete Android game from scratch.

*   [Simple Graphs (‚≠ê48)](https://github.com/earlygrey/simple-graphs) - A java library for graph data structures and algorithms (including fast pathfinding).

### Resources / Physics

*   [jbump (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/tommyettinger/jbump) - Easy to implement AABB collision detection useful for platformers and other simple 2D games.
items.content_html:

  • Simple Graphs (‚≠ê48) - A java library for graph data structures and algorithms (including fast pathfinding).

Resources / Physics

  • jbump (‚≠ê35) - Easy to implement AABB collision detection useful for platformers and other simple 2D games.

items.content_text:
### Resources / Visual Effects

*   [gdx-vfx (‚≠ê201)](https://github.com/crashinvaders/gdx-vfx) - Flexible post-processing shader visual effects based on libgdx-contribs-postprocessing.

### Resources / Others

*   [gdx-dbgagent (‚≠ê34)](https://github.com/PokeMMO/gdx-dbgagent) - Java Agent for debugging common issues, like objects not being disposed and constants such as Color.WHITE being modified.
*   [KTX (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/libktx/ktx) - Kotlin extensions and utilities for libGDX.

Resources / User Interface

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 26 - Sep 01, 2019
items.summary: 10 awesome projects updated on Aug 26 - Sep 01, 2019
items.content_text:
### Resources / Services

*   [gdx-gameanalytics (‚≠ê32)](https://github.com/MrStahlfelge/gdx-gameanalytics) - Game Analytics REST API client implementation for libGDX. Works on all backends.

### Resources / User Interface

*   [Skin Composer (‚≠ê465)](https://github.com/raeleus/skin-composer) - Create skins for libGDX scene2d.ui with a graphical interface.
*   [TenPatch (‚≠ê49)](https://github.com/raeleus/TenPatch) - An alternative to libGDX's 9patch implementation that implements multiple stretch regions.
*   [TypingLabel (‚≠ê161)](https://github.com/rafaskb/typing-label) - A libGDX Label that appears as if it was being typed in real time.
*   [VisUI (‚≠ê757)](https://github.com/kotcrab/vis-ui) - Allows to create nice looking UI in libGDX using scene2d.ui. Note this is not a UI editor.

### Resources / Others

*   [Texture Packer GUI (‚≠ê660)](https://github.com/crashinvaders/gdx-texture-packer-gui) - A simple way to pack and manage texture atlases for libGDX game framework.

### Tutorials / Getting Started

*   [Creating a Launcher](https://youtu.be/3l5F7f7vfTU) - Video tutorial on using libGDX to make a game launcher.
*   [Deploying with JPackage (‚≠ê465)](https://github.com/raeleus/skin-composer/wiki/libGDX-and-JPackage) - A tutorial on deploying libGDX games with JPackage via Gradle commands.

### Tutorials / Advanced

*   [Code Hotswapping](https://youtu.be/zKfh6WuaikQ) - Video tutorial on enabling code hotswapping for libGDX projects to increase productivity.

### Community / General Learning Material

*   [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/libgdx/) - Unofficial subreddit for libGDX. Not a lot of activity.
items.content_html:
Resources / Services

  • gdx-gameanalytics (‚≠ê32) - Game Analytics REST API client implementation for libGDX. Works on all backends.

Resources / User Interface

  • Skin Composer (‚≠ê465) - Create skins for libGDX scene2d.ui with a graphical interface.
  • TenPatch (‚≠ê49) - An alternative to libGDX's 9patch implementation that implements multiple stretch regions.
  • TypingLabel (‚≠ê161) - A libGDX Label that appears as if it was being typed in real time.
  • VisUI (‚≠ê757) - Allows to create nice looking UI in libGDX using scene2d.ui. Note this is not a UI editor.

Resources / Others

  • Texture Packer GUI (‚≠ê660) - A simple way to pack and manage texture atlases for libGDX game framework.

Tutorials / Getting Started

  • Creating a Launcher - Video tutorial on using libGDX to make a game launcher.
  • Deploying with JPackage (‚≠ê465) - A tutorial on deploying libGDX games with JPackage via Gradle commands.

Tutorials / Advanced

  • Code Hotswapping - Video tutorial on enabling code hotswapping for libGDX projects to increase productivity.

Community / General Learning Material

  • Reddit - Unofficial subreddit for libGDX. Not a lot of activity.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 19 - Aug 25, 2019
items.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Aug 19 - Aug 25, 2019
items.content_text:
### Other Lists / General Learning Material

*   [Game Accessibility Guidelines](http://gameaccessibilityguidelines.com/) - A straightforward reference for inclusive game design, to ensure that games are just as fun for as wide a range of people as possible. **Recommended**
items.content_html:
Other Lists / General Learning Material

  • Game Accessibility Guidelines - A straightforward reference for inclusive game design, to ensure that games are just as fun for as wide a range of people as possible. Recommended

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Aug 12 - Aug 18, 2019
items.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Aug 12 - Aug 18, 2019
items.content_text:
### Resources / Controllers

*   [sdl2gdx (‚≠ê82)](https://github.com/electronstudio/sdl2gdx) - Powerful gamepad implementation using SDL. Supports hundreds of controllers under the same mapping, rumble, and hotplugging.

### Resources / Setup and Deployment

*   [Packr (‚≠ê2.6k)](https://github.com/libGDX/packr) - Packages your JAR, assets and a JVM for distribution on Windows, Linux and macOS.

### Resources / Visual Effects

*   [Shape Drawer (‚≠ê193)](https://github.com/earlygrey/shapedrawer) - A performant alternative to ShapeRenderer that avoids Batch flushing.
items.content_html:
Resources / Controllers

  • sdl2gdx (‚≠ê82) - Powerful gamepad implementation using SDL. Supports hundreds of controllers under the same mapping, rumble, and hotplugging.

Resources / Setup and Deployment

  • Packr (‚≠ê2.6k) - Packages your JAR, assets and a JVM for distribution on Windows, Linux and macOS.

Resources / Visual Effects

  • Shape Drawer (‚≠ê193) - A performant alternative to ShapeRenderer that avoids Batch flushing.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jun 10 - Jun 16, 2019
items.summary: 7 awesome projects updated on Jun 10 - Jun 16, 2019
items.content_text:
### Tutorials / Advanced

*   [Dynamic Textures with Pixmap](https://javadocmd.com/blog/libgdx-dynamic-textures-with-pixmap/) - Details how to create a mask using Pixmaps.
*   [iOS Deployment Tutorial](https://link.medium.com/vgYo0mSi3W) - Deploying to iOS in 2019 using RoboVM.
*   [Sub-pixel Perfect Smooth Scrolling](http://code-disaster.com/2016/02/subpixel-perfect-smooth-scrolling.html) - Pixel-perfect smooth scrolling.

### Assets / General Learning Material

*   [Kenney Assets](https://kenney.nl/) - High quality assets for your game, from 2D and 3D art to sound effects.
*   [OpenGameArt.org](https://opengameart.org/) - Repository offering a variety of open content assets.
*   [Game-Icons.net](http://game-icons.net/) - Repository containing heaps of cool game related graphics.
*   [freesound.org](https://freesound.org/) - Huge collaborative database of audio snippets, samples, recordings, bleeps.
items.content_html:
Tutorials / Advanced

  • Dynamic Textures with Pixmap - Details how to create a mask using Pixmaps.
  • iOS Deployment Tutorial - Deploying to iOS in 2019 using RoboVM.
  • Sub-pixel Perfect Smooth Scrolling - Pixel-perfect smooth scrolling.

Assets / General Learning Material

  • Kenney Assets - High quality assets for your game, from 2D and 3D art to sound effects.
  • OpenGameArt.org - Repository offering a variety of open content assets.
  • Game-Icons.net - Repository containing heaps of cool game related graphics.
  • freesound.org - Huge collaborative database of audio snippets, samples, recordings, bleeps.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on Jun 03 - Jun 09, 2019
items.summary: 9 awesome projects updated on Jun 03 - Jun 09, 2019
items.content_text:
### Resources / Algorithms and AI

*   [gdx-ai (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/libgdx/gdx-ai) - Artificial Intelligence framework featuring Steering Behaviors, Formation Motion, Pathfinding, Behavior Trees and Finite State Machines.

### Resources / Controllers

*   [gdx-controllerutils (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/MrStahlfelge/gdx-controllerutils) - Adds Scene2D button input support, user configurable button mappings and hotplugging for LWJGL2.

### Resources / Services

*   [steamworks4j (‚≠ê496)](https://github.com/code-disaster/steamworks4j) - A thin wrapper which allows Java applications to access the Steamworks C++ API.

### Resources / User Interface

*   [gdx-dialogs (‚≠ê80)](https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-dialogs) - Provides cross-platform support for native dialogs.
*   [InGameConsole (‚≠ê136)](https://github.com/StrongJoshua/libGDX-inGameConsole) - Allows a developer to add a console (similar to how it is featured in Source games) to their game.

### Resources / Visual Effects

*   [Box2DLights (‚≠ê262)](https://github.com/libgdx/box2dlights) - 2D lighting framework that uses Box2D for raycasting and OpenGL ES 2.0 for rendering.
*   [Particle Park (‚≠ê75)](https://github.com/raeleus/Particle-Park) - A showcase of downloadable particle effects with live previews.

### Resources / Others

*   [gdxGifRecorder (‚≠ê39)](https://github.com/Anuken/GDXGifRecorder) - A utility class that records a GIF and saves it automatically.
*   [noise4j (‚≠ê105)](https://github.com/czyzby/noise4j) - Simple map generators based on various procedural content generation tutorials.
items.content_html:
Resources / Algorithms and AI

  • gdx-ai (‚≠ê1.3k) - Artificial Intelligence framework featuring Steering Behaviors, Formation Motion, Pathfinding, Behavior Trees and Finite State Machines.

Resources / Controllers

  • gdx-controllerutils (‚≠ê60) - Adds Scene2D button input support, user configurable button mappings and hotplugging for LWJGL2.

Resources / Services

  • steamworks4j (‚≠ê496) - A thin wrapper which allows Java applications to access the Steamworks C++ API.

Resources / User Interface

  • gdx-dialogs (‚≠ê80) - Provides cross-platform support for native dialogs.
  • InGameConsole (‚≠ê136) - Allows a developer to add a console (similar to how it is featured in Source games) to their game.

Resources / Visual Effects

  • Box2DLights (‚≠ê262) - 2D lighting framework that uses Box2D for raycasting and OpenGL ES 2.0 for rendering.
  • Particle Park (‚≠ê75) - A showcase of downloadable particle effects with live previews.

Resources / Others

  • gdxGifRecorder (‚≠ê39) - A utility class that records a GIF and saves it automatically.
  • noise4j (‚≠ê105) - Simple map generators based on various procedural content generation tutorials.

items.title: Awesome Libgdx Updates on May 27 - Jun 02, 2019
items.summary: 17 awesome projects updated on May 27 - Jun 02, 2019
items.content_text:
### Resources / Entity Component System (ECS)

*   [Artemis-odb (‚≠ê811)](https://github.com/junkdog/artemis-odb) - High performance java based Entity-Component-System framework.
*   [Ashley (‚≠ê890)](https://github.com/libgdx/ashley) - A Java entity system inspired by Ash & Artemis.

### Resources / Services

*   [gdx-facebook (‚≠ê60)](https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-facebook) - Provides cross-platform support for Facebook Graph API.
*   [gdx-fireapp (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/mk-5/gdx-fireapp) - Cross-platform API for Firebase.
*   [gdx-firebase (‚≠ê36)](https://github.com/TomGrill/gdx-firebase) - Cross-platform (only Desktop/Android) API for Firebase.
*   [gdx-gamesvcs (‚≠ê115)](https://github.com/MrStahlfelge/gdx-gamesvcs) - Easy integration of gameservices, such as Google Play Games, Apple Game Center, and more.
*   [gdx-pay (‚≠ê230)](https://github.com/libgdx/gdx-pay) - Provides a cross-platform API for InApp purchasing.

### Resources / User Interface

*   [gdx-skins (‚≠ê528)](https://github.com/czyzby/gdx-skins) - Free Scene2D GUI skins.
*   [Ray3K Skins](https://ray3k.wordpress.com/artwork/) - Free Scene2D.UI skins with example code, custom drawables, and experimental features.

### Tutorials / Getting Started

*   [JSON in Game Dev](http://mana-break.blogspot.com/2014/06/power-of-json-in-game-development-items.html) - General tutorial on using JSON for storing data.
*   [Progress Bar Design (‚≠ê465)](https://github.com/raeleus/skin-composer/wiki/The-Man-Who-Killed-Hitler-and-then-The-Progress-Bar) - Discusses the pros and cons of different progress bar design techniques with examples.

### Community / General Learning Material

*   [Discord](https://discord.gg/4S8pQqc) - An active chat with various leaders from the community available every day. **Recommended**

### Other Lists / General Learning Material

*   [Game Networking (‚≠ê8k)](https://github.com/MFatihMAR/Awesome-Game-Networking) - A Curated List of Game Network Programming Resources.
*   [Game Talks (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/hzoo/awesome-gametalks) - A curated list of gaming talks (development, design, etc).
*   [Java (‚≠ê44k)](https://github.com/akullpp/awesome-java) - A curated list of awesome Java frameworks, libraries and software.
*   [Kotlin (‚≠ê11k)](https://github.com/KotlinBy/awesome-kotlin) - A curated list of awesome Kotlin related stuff.
*   [Magic Tools (‚≠ê15k)](https://github.com/ellisonleao/magictools) - A list of Game Development resources to make magic happen.
